title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: in 1322, and four years after, Robert Bruce gave £2000 sterling to rebuild  it This sum, equal to £50,000 of the money of the present day, was raised chiefly from the baronies of Cessford and Eckford, forfeited by Sir Roger de Mowbray, and the lands of Nesbit, Longnewton, M:ixton,and Caverton, forfeited by William Lord Soulis.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Nesbit, Point, a cape on the west coastof the Duke of York's island, in the Dukeof Clarence's strait.
